description.narrative: Urban poverty and unemployment, particularly youth unemployment, are among the most serious problems facing Solomon Islands as the country experiences rapid urbanisation. The 2005-06 Household Income and Expenditure Survey found that a third of the urban population lived below the poverty line, compared to less than 20 per cent of the rural population. The Rapid Employment Project (REP) was developed by the World Bank in consultation with SIG and other development partners. The objectives of the REP are to: increase incomes of the urban poor through the provision of short term employment; and improve their knowledge, experience and basic employment skills that are valued in the work place and society. Funding under this initiative represents additional funding AusAID has agreed to provide to the World Bank for the REP. This will allow the creation of around 104,000 additional person days of short-term employment before the REP concludes in June 2015. The total value of this initiative
